title: Bad location of `#[must_use = "message"]` note in the output.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=80439b95abcd8f9457d87fd7779b9b48

```rust
#![deny(unused_must_use)]

fn main() {
    init();
}

#[must_use = "init() returns a drop guard"]
fn init() -> impl Drop {
    ...
}
```

The current output is:

```
error: unused return value of `init` that must be used
 --> src/main.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     init();
  |     ^^^^^^^
  |
note: the lint level is defined here
 --> src/main.rs:1:9
  |
1 | #![deny(unused_must_use)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: init() returns a drop guard
```

The problem is that the `note: init() returns a drop guard` looks like it's attached to the note about the lint level and not to the error what makes it easy to miss.

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error: unused return value of `init` that must be used
 --> src/main.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     init();
  |     ^^^^^^^
  | note: init() returns a drop guard
  |
note: the lint level is defined here
 --> src/main.rs:1:9
  |
1 | #![deny(unused_must_use)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->
